channel.title: Help with
channel.description: Hey im new to moparscape and scripting and I'd like to know exactly how moparscape works and what you can do on it. It'd be awesome if a mod could say how I could play on someone else's server and how they work. I already know a lot about screwing with html codes if that'll help any at all. Thanks in advance.

item.title: Help with
item.dc:creator: @raiden212 raiden212
item.description:
@raiden212 wrote:

ok hey my name is raiden and im going to tell you some usefull FAQ:
1st.)private servers are not revalant to runescape and not runescape jagex mods!
2.)all servers are seprate but still have rules
3.)private servers are for people that have given up on runescape or got banned -.-
4.)private servers are verry addicting so please dont screw when the restart or you forget to save
5.) you must logg out every 1-10 mins to save you’re accoung incase crashes will not auto-save ur account unlike real runescape
6.)on private server you do not need to pay for member-ship but alltho you still can become a admin or a mod
7.)please read the ::help options for good game play
8.) some server.ip’s have ::discriptions to tell you how to get money and how to do good in the game instead of asking mods all the time
9.)you can swear on most servers at the risk off being banned even tho its only a private servers
10.)dont bug abbuse even tho its only a game people get really parranoid and try to crash the server if you get them parrinod
11.) enjoy the game play at all times
12.) some server ip’s:
jimmyscape.servegame.com : uptimes

darknessscape.no-ip.org: 19.98%

darknessscape.no-ip.info: 28.68%

idareu.servegame.com: 55.73%

dodian.com: 50.47%

4everscape.servegame.com: 65.85%

kieran.servegame.com: 70%

sunscape.no-ip.org: 71.8%

tugarules.no-ip.info: 55.56%

jeulscape.no-ip.org: 41.89%

Read full topic

item.title: Help with
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

In the Moparscape FAQ you can learn how moparscape works, and how to get started.

HTML is quite different than java, but all programming helps all other programming.

Read full topic
